intro: Wissadula rostrata var. zeylanica, commonly known as the Zeylanica variant of the rostrated wissadula, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas or near water bodies. Its foliage is broad and waxy, providing a striking visual contrast to its vibrant blooms.
